title: Karl-Emil Bendtsen
text: Hi! I am a PhD student at the Department of Political Science at the University of Copenhagen. My research is on bureaucracy, discretion, policy uptake, legal complexity, digitalization and the use of AI in public administrations and politics.

title: Karl-Emil Bendtsen
text:
Working papers

Increasing take-up of social benefits: a meta-analysis of field experiments (Conditionally accepted at Journal of Policy Analysis and Managment)
Women’s Impact through the Policy Process: Different Preferences and Agendas – Same Outcomes with Frederik Klaaborg Kjøller & Lene Holm Pedersen. (Resubmitted to Political Science Research & Methods)
Public Administration Beyond Public Administration Journals with Asmus Leth Olsen & Paul van Leeuwen. (Resubmitted to PS: Political Science and Politics)
Longer Laws, Better Service? Legislative Complexity and Bureaucratic Quality with Jonas Krogh Madsen
Noise in Administrative Decision-Making: Public Administration’s Unseen Error and AI’s Role in Enhancing Personnel Selection Consistency with Mogens Jin Pedersen & Florian Keppeler
Can Nominating More Minority Candidates Backfire? with Jacob Richard Bøggild Strabo
